body_content.explanation: relating to or causing hallucinations (= experiences in which you see, hear, feel, or smell something that does not exist):
examples: In some patients the drug has been found to have hallucinatory side effects.
He heard hallucinatory voices telling him what to do.
She had a number of hallucinatory episodes.

body_content.explanation: similar to a hallucination (= an experience in which you see, hear, feel, or smell something that does not exist) because of being strange, not seeming to be completely real, etc.:
examples: She films at night, giving her work a hallucinatory quality.
Huge, hallucinatory paintings cover the walls.

body_content.explanation: relating to false information that is produced by an artificial intelligence (= a computer system that has some of the qualities that the human brain has, such as the ability to produce language in a way that seems human):
examples: One of the big problems with creative AIs is that it is all too easy for them to switch from accurate to hallucinatory.
If the system goes into a hallucinatory state, the advice is to reset the system.
